{"step_by_step_thinking": "If an excessive amount of monomer is incorporated into an acrylic resin mixture, it can result in excessive shrinkage. This is because the excess monomer will evaporate during the polymerization process, causing the resin to shrink more than desired. Excessive expansion, low impact strength, and excessive brittleness are not directly related to the incorporation of excessive monomer.", "answer_choice": "C"}
